suppress.notes: This appears to be a false-positive as this is only exploitable in Spring Framework 5.0.5.RELEASE which we don't use
This is a false positive on gradle-pi-test which fails because it is prefixed with gradle
This is a false positive on gradle-pi-test which fails because it is prefixed with gradle
A low severity security issue was reported in the Gradle signing plugin.
Ignoring app insights netty errors as it's not used
Spring update to 2.2.4.RELEASE causing failures in all health check tests due to missing properties and possible incorrect configuration. Potential solutions were investigated in PR #691

dom4j before 2.1.3 allows external DTDs and External Entities by default, which might enable XXE attacks. However, there is popular external documentation from OWASP showing how to enable the safe, non-default behavior in any application that uses dom4j.
